availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William F. Boone (Hickman County, Kentucky, judge)

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, judge. Davidson County, Tennessee, native. Married to Agnes J. Alloway Boone in 1848. Father of Thomas E. Boone, Bryant A. Boone, Frances E. Boone, James A. Boone, Daniel S. Boone, Sallie W. Boone, Walter P. Boone, William F. Boone, Thomas L. Boone, Joseph E. Boone, and John C. Boone. Judge of the Hickman County Court in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Clinton, pp. 502-03.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, p. 387A.
Ella Hazel Atterbury Spraker, “Samuel Moody Grubbs, a descendant of the Boone Family,”The Boone family; a genealogical history of the descendants of George and Mary Boone who came to America in 1717, (Rutland, VT: The Tuttle Company Publishers, 1922) 475.
“William Felton Boone (1791-1865)," Find A Grave, Memorial 152123808, accessed August 27, 2020, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/152123808.
